Note that the application of Pπ to πU(x) does not change anything, i.e.,
PππU(x) = πU(x). This is expected because according to Deﬁnition 3.10,
we know that a projection matrix Pπ satisﬁes P2
πx= Pπxfor all x.
Remark. With the results from Chapter 4, we can show that πU(x) is an
eigenvector of Pπ, and the corresponding eigenvalue is 1. ♦
